Metadata.title: Dagobang - 0.1% Fee Meme Trading Tool
Metadata.description: Dagobang is a non-custodial browser extension for Meme trading. Trade on-chain directly on your favorite chart sites with silent signing, custom private RPC, and ultra-low fees.

Hero.title: 0.1% Fee Meme Trading Tool
Hero.subtitleLine1: Trade instantly via floating window on your favorite chart sites.
Hero.subtitleLine2: Ultra-low Fees · Self-custody · Private Nodes Anti-MEV
Hero.primaryCtaNote: Chrome / Edge supported · 1 min Fast Install
Hero.alertBody: Current version is in beta. Only for users with Web3 experience. Please use after understanding the risks.

Highlights.title: Born for High-Frequency Trading
Highlights.description: Cutting all friction. Optimizing fees, security, and operation rhythm to the extreme.

fees.title: Ultra-low Fees
fees.body: Plugin fees only 0.1%. Significantly reduces high-frequency trading costs for maximum profit.

nonCustodial.title: Non-custodial Keys
nonCustodial.body: No centralized server. Private keys encrypted and stored locally. Security model consistent with major wallets.
nonCustodial.note: Your Assets Fully Controlled by You

silentSign.title: Silent Signing Mode
silentSign.body: Say goodbye to frequent popups. Auto-sign and broadcast after authorization. Continuous ordering is silky smooth.

rpc.title: Private RPC Support
rpc.body: Connect to self-hosted or paid private nodes to avoid public node rate limits or front-running.

overlay.title: Seamless Overlay Experience
overlay.body: Does not change original browsing habits. Non-intrusive floating window overlaid on the page. Ready to use.

HowItWorks.title: How Dagobang Works?
HowItWorks.intro: From chart viewing to execution, the entire link is locally constructed, wallet signed, and RPC broadcast.

step1.title: Browse Token on Chart Sites
step1.body: Open your habitual chart site. Dagobang will attempt to identify the current token contract address (e.g., BSC contract) from the page.

step2.title: Get Quotes via RPC & DEX
step2.body: Plugin uses your configured RPC node to read on-chain data and fetch prices, depth, and estimated slippage via DEX / Aggregator official APIs.

step3.title: Construct Transaction Locally
step3.body: You select buy or sell, set amount and slippage in the floating window. Dagobang constructs the corresponding Swap transaction locally.

step4.title: Browser Silent Signing
step4.body: After wallet connection and basic authorization, transactions initiated by Dagobang can be silently signed within the browser, usually without per-transaction popup confirmations.

step5.title: Broadcast On-Chain & View Results
step5.body: Signed transactions are broadcast to the chain via your chosen RPC. You can check status and history in your wallet or block explorer.

Install.title: How to Install Dagobang Plugin (Chrome / Edge)
Install.subtitle: Start your high-speed trading journey in 4 simple steps
Install.intro: Currently requires manual loading of the unzipped extension package. The whole process takes about 1 minute.

ctaPanel.title: Ready to start?
ctaPanel.body: Download Dagobang now and experience the next generation of on-chain trading tools.

step1.title: Download Plugin Package
step1.body: Click 'Download Extension (Beta)' at the top of the page, save the zip file locally and unzip it to any directory.

step2.title: Open Extensions Page
step2.body: Enter chrome://extensions in the browser address bar and press Enter. Turn on 'Developer mode' in the top right corner.

step3.title: Load Unpacked Extension
step3.body: Click 'Load unpacked' and select the plugin folder you just unzipped. After successful installation, you will see the Dagobang icon in the top right corner of the browser.

step4.title: Pin Plugin Icon (Optional)
step4.body: Click the small puzzle icon in the top right, find Dagobang in the list, and pin it to the toolbar for easy access at any time.

FAQ.title: FAQ
FAQ.intro: Here are a few common questions. For more, feel free to contact us at the bottom.

q1.question: Does Dagobang custody my assets or private keys?
q1.answer: No. We do not touch your private keys. All assets and signatures are managed by your browser wallet. The security model is consistent with mainstream wallet plugins.

q2.question: What are the fees for Dagobang?
q2.answer: The plugin fee is in the 0.1% range. You also need to pay on-chain Gas and DEX protocol fees.

q3.question: Is silent signing really safe?
q3.answer: Silent signing can significantly reduce interruptions and improve experience, but it also reduces manual confirmation steps. Please use it only after confirming the reliability of the installation package source, fully understanding the working principle, and trusting this plugin.

q4.question: Is Dagobang an official plugin of a chart site?
q4.answer: No. Dagobang is an independently developed third-party tool and has no official cooperation or affiliation with any chart platform.

q5.question: Why support custom privacy RPC?
q5.answer: Custom privacy RPC can avoid all requests being concentrated on public nodes, reducing the risk of rate limiting, monitoring, or front-running, while improving stability and response speed under high-frequency trading. You can also continue to use the default RPC without any modification.

q6.question: Which chains are currently supported?
q6.answer: The current version mainly supports BSC chain trading. Solana is the next chain we prioritize in our plan and will be launched gradually in subsequent versions.

q7.question: Why can trades be sent without a popup confirmation?
q7.answer: After you enter your password and unlock the wallet inside the extension, the decrypted key temporarily resides in your browser's memory. In scenarios where silent signing is enabled, Dagobang uses this key locally to sign transactions without opening a popup for every single one, trading one layer of confirmation for faster execution. You can lock the extension at any time or revoke its permissions in your wallet to clear the key from memory and return to a popup based flow.

q8.question: How should I configure custom RPC endpoints?
q8.answer: In the extension settings, enter one RPC URL per line. It is recommended to mix endpoints from different providers, for example a combination of public and paid nodes, and to prioritize official or reputable providers you trust. This helps balance speed, stability and privacy instead of relying on a single crowded public endpoint.

Contact.title: Contact & Roadmap
Contact.intro: Dagobang is still iterating fast. Any feedback is welcome.
Contact.shortTerm2: Optimize silent signing & RPC interaction experience.
Contact.shortTerm3: Improve adaptation for mainstream chart sites.
Contact.longTerm1: Launch more automated auxiliary trading tools.

Privacy.title: Dagobang Browser Extension Privacy Policy
Privacy.intro: The Dagobang browser extension ("the Extension") is provided by the Dagobang team. The Extension is designed around the principles of least privilege and non‑custodial architecture. We do not collect or upload any personally identifiable information.

section1.title: 1. What data do we collect?
section1.body: The Extension does not collect your name, email, phone number or other personal identity information. It does not collect your browsing history, search queries, chat content or similar personal content, and it does not collect device fingerprints, advertising identifiers or other cross‑site tracking identifiers. The Extension does not upload user data to servers controlled by us, nor do we sell or share user data with third parties.

section2.title: 2. Local storage and on‑chain data
section2.body: To provide its functionality, the Extension stores certain information in your browser's local storage that is directly related to your use, such as plugin configuration (network selection, gas presets, slippage parameters, RPC settings, etc.), encrypted wallet key material (for example, encrypted private keys), and UI preferences (floating window position, notification placement, etc.). This data is stored only on your local device and is used solely to provide the Extension's functionality and improve your experience. We cannot access this data. Any on‑chain transaction records you create through the Extension (such as transaction hashes, addresses and amounts) are stored on the blockchain itself and can be viewed by anyone via block explorers. This is an inherent property of public ledgers and is not data collected or controlled by us.

section3.title: 3. Third‑party services
section3.body: The Extension may call blockchain RPC nodes, decentralized trading protocols or price/market data APIs to fetch on‑chain data and market information. These requests are made directly by your browser. We do not aggregate or permanently store logs of these requests on our own servers.

section4.title: 4. Data sharing and commercial use
section4.body: We do not sell, rent or commercially exploit user data to any third party. The Extension does not run ads, does not perform remarketing and does not build user profiles, nor do we use data for any purposes unrelated to enabling on‑chain trading functionality.

section5.title: 5. Security and risk notice
section5.body: Please keep your device, browser and wallet environment secure, and never share your seed phrase or private keys with anyone. If you obtain the Extension from unofficial sources, there may be a risk of tampering; always ensure that your download source is trustworthy. The Extension is a browser‑side tool and cannot replace your own judgement and management of your security environment.

section6.title: 6. Policy updates and contact
section6.body: If we make significant changes to this Privacy Policy in the future, we will announce them on the official website or on the extension listing page. Your continued use of the Extension will be deemed acceptance of the updated policy. If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us using the channels provided on the official website.

Security.title: Non-custodial design, security model and risk boundaries
Security.intro: Dagobang is a local browser extension. It does not custody your assets or private keys. We aim to balance UX and safety, but like any hot wallet the real security boundary is your device environment and personal practices.

nonCustodial.title: Local non‑custodial storage
nonCustodial.body: Your seed phrase and private keys are encrypted and stored only in the browser, never on our servers. The encryption key is derived from the password you choose, and you can lock or reset it at any time.

noServer.title: Zero backend dependency
noServer.body: Dagobang talks directly to blockchain nodes and DEX or aggregator APIs. There is no proprietary custody backend in the middle, reducing single‑point failure and centralised data leakage risks.

leastPrivilege.title: Least privilege permissions
leastPrivilege.body: The extension only requests the minimal browser permissions it needs, such as storing configuration and accessing the active tab. You can review and revoke these permissions in your browser at any time.

silentSign.title: Boundaries of silent signing
silentSign.body: Once you unlock and grant permissions, Dagobang can silently sign in agreed‑upon scenarios to avoid repeated popups and improve high‑frequency trading experience. Only enable and use this if you fully understand and accept how it works.

metamaskCompare.title: Security model compared to MetaMask
metamaskCompare.intro: From a cryptographic perspective, Dagobang is on the same level as mainstream browser wallets. The key differences are in UX and target use cases.

items.0: Non‑custodial local encryption is the same: both Dagobang and MetaMask encrypt your seed and keys locally and never upload them to a server, deriving the encryption key from your password.
items.1: Unlocked keys live briefly in memory: for both MetaMask and Dagobang, once you unlock the wallet the browser process temporarily holds a plaintext key to sign transactions. If the device is already compromised by malware, no hot wallet can offer perfect protection.
items.2: The real difference is in interaction: MetaMask usually prompts you with a confirmation window for each transaction, while Dagobang uses silent signing in agreed scenarios after you unlock, reducing popups and better fitting fast, high‑frequency trading.

metamaskCompare.summary: In short: for local encryption and non‑custodial design Dagobang is comparable to MetaMask. What primarily determines your risk is how clean your device is, how you manage approvals and how much capital you keep in hot wallets.

items.0: Trading digital assets and meme tokens is extremely risky and may result in partial or total loss of principal due to volatility, project failure, contract bugs, hacks or regulatory changes.
items.1: Dagobang is a browser extension only. It is not investment advice, a financial product or any form of yield guarantee.
items.2: All trades conducted through Dagobang are based on your own judgement. You bear full responsibility for any outcomes.
items.3: Dagobang does not guarantee the security, reliability or legality of any third‑party websites, smart contracts, protocols or projects you interact with.
items.4: Before using the extension, ensure that participation in relevant digital‑asset activities is permitted in your jurisdiction and that you understand and comply with all applicable laws and regulations.
items.5: To the maximum extent permitted by law, the Dagobang team is not liable for any direct or indirect loss arising from the use of, or reliance on, the extension or any information it provides.
